appDesc.message: Custom color schemes for all websites: night mode, dark themes, blue light filter, screen shader, high contrast, grayscale, etc.

applyBtn_@title.message: Apply current settings on the current website

applyOnPageFailureMessage.message: Settings application failed. Refresh the page and try again.

backgroundColor_@title.message: Background color to be used in a generated color scheme

backgroundContrast_@title.message:
Minimal difference in brightness between similar backgrounds.
Depends on elements size and order so results might be quite random.

backgroundExampleOriginal_@title.message: Original background colors being processed above

backgroundExampleWithContrast_@title.message:
Example of processing different background colors with increased contrast.
Contrast depends on an element size so on the real page it might look different.

backgroundExampleWithoutContrast_@title.message: Example of processing different background colors with no contrast changes.

backgroundExample_@title.message: Example of processing different background colors

backgroundGrayHue_@title.message: Hue to be used to increase saturation of the gray background colors

backgroundGraySaturation_@title.message: Saturation of the gray backgrounds after applying selected default hue

backgroundHueGravity_@title.message:
Determines how all other hues will be affected by the selected default hue.
The stronger gravity, the closer all other hues will be moved towards the selected default hue.
Saturation limit will be used for affected hues.
Does not work if 'Replace all' hues is checked.
'Replace all' hues works faster and should be preferred over 100% gravity.

backgroundImageExampleText_@title.message:
If this website has background images behind the text
then you should adjust background images brightness level
until you would be able to see the text over the image clearly.

backgroundImageLightnessLimit_@title.message: Limit of background images brightness. The smaller image, the brighter it is.

colorSchemeDeleteConfirmationMessage.message:
You are about to delete color scheme '$color_scheme_for_edit_name$'.
Deleting system color schemes will just remove all overrides from the specified color scheme. There is no way to completely delete any system color scheme. Are you sure want to continue?

You can create a new scheme and update or delete existing color scheme.

colorSchemeImportNotSupportedMessage.message: Color schemes import from files is not supported in Firefox

colorSchemeImportSuccessMessage.message:
$imported_color_schemes_count$ color schemes have been successfully imported from the files.
Imported color schemes are marked with a $edit_mark$ symbol and will be deleted with the popup closure unless you save each of them.
To save imported color scheme select it in the 'Current color scheme' dropdown list and press 'Save' button.

Delete all websites' settings, but keep all color schemes, global and default settings.

deleteColorSchemeBtn_@title.message: Delete color scheme selected for edit

doNotInvertContent_@title.message:
Check this option to prevent dynamic content from being inverted.
This option controls whether content like maps, PDF files, dynamic drawings,
animated images, etc can be inverted when background changes to dark.
When content is inverted it is processed based on the current settings for backgrounds,
and when it is not inverted then it is processed based on the current settings for images.

editSchemesTab_@tooltip.description:
text on the tooltip/hint with custom style
COPY THE FORMATTING SYMBOLS FROM THE SOURCE AND CENTER THE HEADER
editSchemesTab_@tooltip.message:
Color schemes editing
―――――――――――――――――――
 Settings currently applied on the popup can be used to create a new color scheme or update an existing one. If you create a new color scheme it will be available on all other websites.
 Even after creation you can adjust your color scheme, update it once and changes will be automatically applied to all websites where this color scheme is used. You can also delete your color scheme at any time.
 The same way you can override predefined color schemes with new settings and names. Deletion of the predefined color schemes will only remove overrides and restore their original state.
 Find more examples under the question mark in the popup top-left corner.

emailLink_@tooltip.description: text on the tooltip/hint with custom style

excludeMatches_@title.message:
Page won't be processed if its url matches any of these patterns.
Write each pattern on a new line.
Exclude rules have the lowest precedence hence they will always win.

exportColorSchemeBtn_@title.message: Export to file selected color scheme for edit '$color_scheme_for_edit$' with name '$color_scheme_name$' and replace all its settings with currently applied on the popup settings from '$current_color_scheme$'.

Delete all customizations for all websites, all color schemes and all global settings.
Restore all factory defaults.

forgetThisSiteBtn_@title.message:
Delete only current website settings.
Default settings will be used on that website afterwards.

generateFromColorsButton_@title.message:
Generate a new color scheme from the specified colors.
A new color scheme will be merged with the current one.
So it makes sense to select the most similar existing color
scheme before generating a new one.

includeMatches_@title.message:
If 'Run on this website' is unchecked,
but page url matches at least one of these patterns
then it will be still considered for processing.
Write each pattern on a new line.
If 'Run on this website' is checked
then all include match patterns will be ignored.

introduction_html_content.description:
Html markup of the introduction tab.
Copy it and then replace the text with your translations.
introduction_html_content.message:
Introduction

To enable or disable an entire extension switch the toggle button in the top-right corner. You also can toggle any particular website between blocklist and allowlist by clicking on its label on the popup header bar.

You can choose one of the predefined color schemes from the drop-down list on the right pane and use it off the shelf. You can install more color schemes from $website$.

Apart from that you can adjust your chosen scheme as you wish. For this purpose you have all the settings in the tabs on the left pane. Any changes you would have made will be immediately applied but only on the popup so you can safely play with it.

To assign the settings of your preference to the current website press Apply button on the right pane. Or you can add your scheme to the list of the predefined color schemes for further use on any other website.

If you want to set up current settings as a default settings for all websites press Set as default button on the right pane.

You can find more help on the support forum, read existing tutorials or ask a new question.

Subscribe to the Midnight Lizard's social channels and stay tuned for the latest updates and the new features.

text on the label.
Should be conjugated to be a correct part of the phrase: settings for 'local files'

localStorageOverrideConfirmationMessage.message:
Your local settings storage already contains some data.
Do you want to override it with data from the sync (cloud) storage
and lose the overridden data?

localStorage_QUOTA_BYTES_ErrorMessage.message: Browser limits total local storage available for each extension to $limit$ bytes. You have exceeded this limit. You have to delete custom color schemes or custom settings from some websites in order to store new settings.

longDescription.description: long extension description displayed in the Web Store
longDescription.message:
Midnight Lizard color schemes work across all websites. The extension offers many predefined color schemes to choose from, or you’re free to explore and install more at midnight-lizard.org
  ✔ Choose between dark, light, grayscale or colorful color schemes
  ✔ Modify existing or create new color schemes
  ✔ Use different color schemes on each website
  ✔ Adjust brightness, saturation, contrast and hues
  ✔ Improve accessibility and readability
  ✔ Increase contrast to make text easier to read
  ✔ Apply blue light filter to shift all colors towards red light
  ✔ Keep original images and hues without inversion
  ✔ Schedule automatic activation and deactivation
  ✔ Use keyboard shortcuts to toggle extension
     ⮚ on current website: Alt+Shift+L
     ⮚ globally: Alt+Shift+M
  ✔ Use with PDF and local files (enable in browser settings)
  ✔ Shade bright colors and images
  ✔ Change any colour you want
  ✔ Dynamically change browser theme (disabled by default)
  ✔ Sync your settings
  ✔ Configure background, text, buttons, links, borders, images and scrollbars
  ✔ Apply globally, per-website or with url match patterns
  ✔ Switch between websites blocklist and allowlist modes
  ✔ Use Simplified mode to improve performance on heavy websites
  ✔ Contribute to our open source project on GitHub.com/Midnight-Lizard
  ✔ Donate to our OpenCollective.com/Midnight-Lizard

Please use browser themes in order to style New Tab page, tabs and toolbars - extensions cannot do that.
Also extensions don't work on New Tab page, Chrome Web Store and browser settings.

matchCurrentPage_@title.message: The following patterns match current page:

matchCurrentPage_text_message.message: Some of the patterns match current page

matchPatternsSyntaxLink_@title.message:
Open a complete match patterns syntax description in a new browser tab.
Popup might be closed.

maxBackgroundImageSize_@title.message:
Maximum size of background images in KiB.
If 'Hide big background images' is checked then background images
with size bigger then specified here will be hidden if processed.

modeAutoSwitchLimit_@title.message:
If there are more elements on the page during its initial load
than the specified here limit and 'Automatic' mode is used
then the actual processing mode for this page will be switched
from 'Complex' to 'Simplified'.

mode_automatic_@title.message:
Automatic page processing mode will switch from 'Complex' mode to 'Simplified'
if current page has more elements than the 'Automatic mode switch limit'.

mode_complex_@title.message: Complex page processing mode is not fast but looks very good

mode_filter_@title.message:
Simple global filter over the whole page.
Most of the settings are ignored in this mode.
Might be very resource intense.
Works better in a grayscale mode or when
gray background and gray text saturation are less than 10%.

mode_options_@title.message: Hover each option to see its description

mode_simplified_@title.message: Simplified page processing mode is not accurate but works very fast

noMatchForCurrentPage_text_message.message: None of the patterns match current page

popupDisconnected_html_error_message.message:
Midnight Lizard cannot connect to this page

probably because of one of the following reasons
  • Web browser cannot run extensions on the pages like:
    Web Store, Settings, New Tab, etc.

  • 'Midnight Lizard' might has been updated or just installed
    so page needs to be refreshed

  • Current page might be represented by a local file,
    but you have not allowed 'Midnight Lizard' to process local files

※ Just try it on a regular website first

TIP
Midnight Lizard is an extension so it cannot change colors of browser tabs and toolbars. For this purpose you need to install or change a custom browser theme.

syncChangeFailureMessage.message: Failed to change settings sync option.

syncSettings_@title.message:
Sync 'Midnight Lizard' settings across all your devices where this option is also checked.
When checked custom settings for each website will be merged from all devices but a list of custom color schemes will be overridden with the latest one. So make sure that you are online when you edit custom schemes.
You also need to enable 'Sync' in the browser settings in order for 'Midnight Lizard' settings synchronization to work.

syncStorageOverrideConfirmationMessage.message:
Your sync (cloud) settings storage already contains some data.
Do you want to override it with data from the local storage
and lose the overridden data?

syncStorage_MAX_ITEMS_ErrorMessage.message: Browser limits total number of records in the sync storage available for each extension to $limit$ records. You have exceeded this limit. You can switch to local storage on 'Global settings' tab in Midnight Lizard's settings popup and all settings will be automatically transferred to local storage.

syncStorage_MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_HOU.message: Browser limits how often extensions can write into sync storage to $limit$ times per hour. You have exceeded this limit. Please try again later or switch to local storage on 'Global settings' tab in Midnight Lizard's settings popup and all settings will be automatically transferred to local storage.

syncStorage_MAX_WRITE_OPERATIONS_PER_MIN.message: Browser limits how often extensions can write into sync storage to $limit$ times per minute. You have exceeded this limit. Please try again later or switch to local storage on 'Global settings' tab in Midnight Lizard's settings popup and all settings will be automatically transferred to local storage.

syncStorage_QUOTA_BYTES_ErrorMessage.message: Browser limits total sync storage available for each extension to $limit$ bytes. You have exceeded this limit. You can switch to local storage on 'Global settings' tab in Midnight Lizard's settings popup and all settings will be automatically transferred to local storage.
